page.title: 16Transport an Communications
page.content: One of the drawbacks to Sanquhar growing much more is the geography of the area. Surrounded by hills, and in the narrow valley created by the River Nith, Sanquhar can only expand by following the course of the river. The other main concern for any company setting up in the town would be the inadequacy of transport facilities. Although on the main A76 trunk road running from S to N, the only routes eastwards follow very narrow valleys with very steep gradients. There is no egress from the town westwards. There is no longer a railway station even though the Glasgow-Carlisle line runs through the town. Townspeople who do not own a car find it very difficult to travel outwith the immediate area as the bus service has been greatly reduced over the last 5 years. The nearest airport is in Glasgow.
